column4: I'm looking for a emule client for ubuntu. Whats the package name for a apt-get install?
probably the routing table  is invalid after configuring the eth1 connection
if i put iptables -F is to work fine?
what does iptables have to do with the routing table?
i think that when you add the eth1 connection you end up with two default gateaways and you only can have one
but to be sure you have to check the output od « ip route »

here is what im trying to do... I want to share the wlan0 connection with a other pc connected in the eth1. Wlan0 is DHCP with my router hardware. So to do this i need to manually make a eth1 connection with other pc and use iptables to share connection right?
that'as a way to do it
a simple sudo ifconfig eth1 10.1.1.100 is a correct way to manually enter an ip to eth1?
ok thanks, seems to be ok now. Both computers are ping each other
to make the change permanent you will have to use the interfaces file /etc/network/interfaces
to share the command iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o wlan0 -j MASQUERADE  is right?
i think you have to specify the in interface add  "-i eth1" ?
thakns for the tip man. I will restart know to see if works
